meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inviolate or unbroken.
meanings.sent1: The inviolacy of the ancient artifact was evident by its pristine condition.
meanings.sent2: The inviolacy of the treaty was crucial for maintaining peace between the nations.
meanings.sent3: Despite the mischievous attempts, the inviolacy of the secret remained intact.
meanings.sent4: Her inviolacy of mind shielded her from the chaos of the world.
meanings.sent5: The inviolacy of the fortress walls stood as a symbol of strength and protection.

meanings.definition: The condition of being free from violation or desecration.
meanings.sent1: The inviolacy of the sacred ground was respected by all who visited.
meanings.sent2: The inviolacy of the crime scene was crucial for the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The inviolacy of the cookie jar was challenged by the mischievous child.
meanings.sent4: The inviolacy of her personal space was breached by the intrusive questions.
meanings.sent5: The inviolacy of the forest was a sanctuary for diverse wildlife.
